columns.name: domain_name
columns.description: The custom domain name as an API host name.

columns.name: certificate_arn
columns.description: The reference to an AWS-managed certificate that will be used by edge-optimized endpoint for this domain name.

columns.name: certificate_name
columns.description: The name of the certificate that will be used by edge-optimized endpoint for this domain name.

columns.name: certificate_upload_date
columns.description: The timestamp when the certificate that was used by edge-optimized endpoint for this domain name was uploaded.

columns.name: distribution_domain_name
columns.description: The domain name of the Amazon CloudFront distribution associated with this custom domain name for an edge-optimized endpoint.

columns.name: distribution_hosted_zone_id
columns.description: The region-agnostic Amazon Route 53 Hosted Zone ID of the edge-optimized endpoint. The valid value is Z2FDTNDATAQYW2 for all the regions.

columns.name: domain_name_status
columns.description: The status of the DomainName migration. The valid values are AVAILABLE and UPDATING. If the status is UPDATING, the domain cannot be modified further until the existing operation is complete.

columns.name: domain_name_status_message
columns.description: An optional text message containing detailed information about status of the DomainName migration.

columns.name: ownership_verification_certificate_arn
columns.description: The ARN of the public certificate issued by ACM to validate ownership of your custom domain. Only required when configuring mutual TLS and using an ACM imported or private CA certificate ARN as the regionalCertificateArn.

columns.name: regional_certificate_arn
columns.description: The reference to an AWS-managed certificate that will be used for validating the regional domain name. AWS Certificate Manager is the only supported source.

columns.name: regional_certificate_name
columns.description: The name of the certificate that will be used for validating the regional domain name.

columns.name: regional_domain_name
columns.description: The domain name associated with the regional endpoint for this custom domain name. You set up this association by adding a DNS record that points the custom domain name to this regional domain name. The regional domain name is returned by API Gateway when you create a regional endpoint.

columns.name: regional_hosted_zone_id
columns.description: The region-specific Amazon Route 53 Hosted Zone ID of the regional endpoint. For more information, see Set up a Regional Custom Domain Name and AWS Regions and Endpoints for API Gateway.

columns.name: security_policy
columns.description: The Transport Layer Security (TLS) version + cipher suite for this DomainName. The valid values are TLS_1_0 and TLS_1_2.

columns.name: endpoint_configuration
columns.description: The endpoint configuration of this DomainName showing the endpoint types of the domain name.

columns.name: mutual_tls_authentication
columns.description: The mutual TLS authentication configuration for a custom domain name. If specified, API Gateway performs two-way authentication between the client and the server. Clients must present a trusted certificate to access your API.
